fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

[Questions for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211644/questions-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] hosted on Cloud is only available in English while the one installing to Confluence Server is translated.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add translation of [supported languages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/languages-744721667.html].

h3. Workaround

None. Add yourself to this issue as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the translation work moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Translation request for Questions for Confluence

fields.description:
By default, when an attachment is inserted into a Confluence page, the same will provide the user with an option to see the preview for it (mostly for PDF and Word files, for example). However, when tapping on the option to *Open in a new tab* with browsers like Chrome and Firefox, the file will be automatically downloaded, instead of previewed in a new tab.

For the Server edition of Confluence, [there is a workaround|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/pdf-files-no-longer-open-in-browser-users-are-prompted-to-download-370704789.html] that would allow this option to be available by changing the *Attachments Download Security Policy* to *Insecure*, but, in Cloud, this option does not change the behavior.

This is a suggestion to allow such option to be done in Cloud, by default. As a workaround, the user will need to manually insert the preview link into a link in the editor.
fields.summary: Option to preview attachments in a new tab

fields.description:
At the moment, Users need to choose the space during the first login in Confluence. 

It would be great if the admins could choose a default space from the UI. Even when a homepage is set, the end users still need to choose a space during on-boarding.
fields.summary: Allow Admins to configure default space during first login for all users

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

When we add a Chart Macro and pull data from Jira, there is only one visual option to display the data

Suggested Solution

Add more display options for the Chart, such as the one that is used on Jira
h2. Why this is important

To enhance the user experience, allowing them to have more options to display their data and have a nice looking content on Confluence pages.
fields.summary: More displays options for Jira Chart Macro

fields.description:
It'd be great if we could order the Jira Macro columns based on the issue status from a Jira Project.

It would help to better organize Jira Projects reports on Confluence for the teams.
fields.summary: Ability to order columns in JIRA Macro based on the issue status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing Meeting Notes in spaces automatically replaces Meeting notes in Global templates. 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to space settings > Content Tools
# Edit *Meeting Notes* template from the space and save changes
# Navigate to Global templates and search for Meeting Notes

h3. Expected Results
Space template (Meeting Notes) shouldn't replace global template

h3. Actual Results
Space template (Meeting Notes) replace global template

h3. Notes
This issue only happens to *Meeting Notes*. 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Meeting Notes from spaces replaces Meeting notes in global templates

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you have any of the following macros in the old editor.
{noformat}
Info Macro
Panel Macro
Status Macro
{noformat}
The page will not be migrated to the Fabric editor

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using the Old editor, add info macro, panel macro, status macro to a page
# Opt-in to Confluence new experience
# Edit the page that you created in step 1 

h3. Expected Results
* The page should be migrated to new Confluence Editor when edited. 


h3. Actual Results
* The page is not being migrated to new Confluence editor. 

h3. Workaround
- none
fields.summary: New Confluence editor doesn't apply when editing an existing page

fields.description:
h3.Summary
There is a Draft Vs Published Page discrepancy for 3rd Party Add-on Macros in Fabric. 

h3. Environment
Any Cloud Instance which has Fabric Enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Page
# In Fabric, add a macro from a 3rd party add-on.  
# Publish the page



h3. Expected Results
The Macro renders without any issues.
h3. Actual Results
The Macro does not render on the first attempt, but reloading the page fixes the issue.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: 3rd Party Add-on Macros have a different ID in the Draft and the Published version of Fabric Pages

fields.description:
*Summary*
In the new editor, when you paste a bullet list in a panel, the panel disappears (only if the panel is empty). See the video below.
 !Panel bug.gif! 

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Go to the edit mode in the new editor
 # Create a bullet list
 # Create a panel
 # Copy the bullet list in the *empty* panel

*Expected Results*
Bullet list is pasted within the panel

*Actual Results*
Panel disappears

*Workaround*
Add a character within the panel before pasting the bullet list.
 !workaround.gif!
fields.summary: In the new editor the panel (if empty) disappears if a bullet list is pasted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Topics under questions for Confluence gets created even when you type them and dont choose to save them.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * Question for confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the add-on "Question for Confluence"
 # Inside the space, Navigate to Questions on the left sidebar and click on "Ask a Question"
 # Type keywords to search inside the "Topic" field

h3. Expected Results

Whatever keyword is typed should not be saved as topics automatically.
h3. Actual Results

It creates topics of whatever keyword is used to search (attached video)

Due to this customers have thousands of topics created for random words which they used for searching in "Topic" field.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Topics under questions for Confluence gets created even without adding them

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
If you have a page that contains inline comments inside sections, those comments are lost once the page is published in the new editing experience. 

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Create a page on the old editor
# Include a section and some text
# Publish the page and add some inline comments on the text
# Now, once the new editor is implemented, edit the page again
# Publish the page with the new editor

h3. Expected Behavior
The page gets published with some minor changes due to the layout differences

h3. Actual Behavior
The inline comments are lost once the page is published
fields.summary: Content created in old editor loses Inline Comments on Sections once migrated to new Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we export pages to PDF, both heading 4 and 6 are incorrectly formatted in the resulting export. 
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * Any browser
 * Any desktop OS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page using the New Editing Experience (Fabric editor)
 # Add text
 # format different sections of the text with heading sizes 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
 # Publish page
 # Export this page to pdf

h3. Expected Results

Exported page headings respect original formatting
h3. Actual Results

Heading 4 and 6 will be incorrectly formatted. Both will be bigger than headings above them and will display incorrect bolding, italic and font.
h3. Workaround

No workaround as of today.
fields.summary: Exporting pages to PDF results in incorrect heading formatting for heading 4 and 6

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Users have more than 200 version of a page and on page history, it's only showing the last 99 pages.

h2. How to replicate

# Create a page
# Update the page 110 time
# After that go to page history

h2. Observed behavior

It will only show the last 99 versions.


h2. Expected behavior

It should display all the page versions.

h2. Workaround
Open any version and modify the URL to point to the specific version you want to access:
https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=<PAGE_ID>&pageVersion=<VERSION_NUMBER>
fields.summary: Page history only displaying 99 version

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you have several images using the old editor. It will display white spaces above and below the images after migration to Fabric Editor. The is no way to resize the images as well, the menu to set the alignment for all the images will not display. 

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using the Old editor, add several images to a page. 
# Save the page. 
# Migrate the page to Fabric Editor

h3. Expected Results
* The images should display properly and should have an option to resize and align after migrating to Fabric Editor

h3. Actual Results
 It will display white spaces above and below the images after migration to Fabric Editor. The is no way to resize the images as well, the menu to set the alignment for all the images will not display. 

h3. Workaround
- none
fields.summary: Issues with Images using new Confluence editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you use the Page Properties table and use the "Hidden = True" parameter in the old editor. The parameter is ignored when the page was migrated to Fabric Editor

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using the Old editor, add a Page Properties macro to a page
# Check the "Hidden" parameter
# Save the page (Noticed that the Page properties macro) will be hidden
# Migrate the page to Fabric Editor
# The Page Properties macro that was set to Hidden in Step 2 will always display. 

h3. Expected Results
* Page properties macro that was set to hidden should still apply in the new Fabric Editor

h3. Actual Results
* Page properties macro that was set to hidden should is ignored in the new Fabric Editor
 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Hidden" not working for Page Properties macro in new editor

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If more than one user is editing the same document in Companion App, there is no warning, and the last person to save the document will overwrite any other changes made by previous users.
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement concurrent editing or warn when another user is editing the document to prevent overwrites.
h3. Why this is important

Currently, a user could lose a lot of work they've done if they are unaware that another user is editing.
h3. Workaround 

No current workaround.
fields.summary: Implement concurrent editing of documents using Companion App

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Team Calendars doesn't respond with all the registered events in subscription link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add some events (say 5) with specifying several event-types to a new calendar
# Get subscription link for the calendar
# Access to the provided URL and see how many events will be returned



h3. Expected Results

All of the registered events will be included in subscription link.

h3. Actual Results

Only some of the registered events are included (the condition is unknown). It can be verified with the command like below:

{noformat}
$ curl -L https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/export/subcalendar/private/__SECRET__.ics | grep "BEGIN:VEVENT" | wc -l
2
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

None. Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
As "Export to iCalendar" is also affected (CONFCLOUD-65589), it's not possible to use it as a workaround.
fields.summary: Team Calendars doesn't return some of registered events in subscription link

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using a custom theme that does not override the space homepage results in a status 404 and does not load the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Follow https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/create-a-confluence-theme/
# Set {{routeOverride}} to false
# Use the theme

h3. Expected Results
Default overview

h3. Actual Results
Endless spinner is shown with a status 404 in the dev console. The route to {{spaceview}} is still being checked.

h3. Notes
Raised in https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/custom-theme-cant-load-default-overview/26874
fields.summary: Custom Theme Can’t Load Default Overview

fields.description:
Currently, when navigating a Calendar, in order for me to go back 4 years, I have to click 48 times with a 5 - 10 second delay between clicks.

We need to be able to jump to a specific month/year or click a button that goes forward/backwards a year to see details & names of past events.
fields.summary: Allow the creation of a "link" to a month/year of a calendar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the [new editing experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], by using the C# (currently listed as CSharp) for syntax highlighting in the [Code Block macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/code-block-macro-724765175.html], it will not work/highlight the code specifically.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or edit an existing page with the new editing improvements.
# Add a Code-Block/Code Snippet macro and add a code with the C# language
# Select C# (CSharp) as the syntax highlighting
# Publish the Page

h3. Expected Results
The code should be highlighted according to the selected language.

h3. Actual Results
No highlight is applied. The code is displayed as pure text within the macro.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Code Block for Fabric Editor does not have Syntax Highlight for C#

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
Right now, if you have more than a single event per day on your Team Calendar, and you export the Calendar to .ics, once imported, the calendar only imports a single event a day.

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Create a new calendar
# Insert 3 events per day, for instance
# Export the calendar
# Import in any other calendar

h3. Expected Results
The calendar will import all of the events, and will look just like the one in the application

h3. Actual Results
A single event is imported to the destination calendar.
fields.summary: Exporting Calendar from Team Calendar Only Exports one Event a day

fields.description: Users want to be able to send e-mail notifications from the Team Calendars add-on to specific users only.
fields.summary: Allow Calendar notifications to be sent to specific users only

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Videos generated on iOS devices do not reproduce sound when added to Confluence pages.

h3. Environment
* Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a video with the iOS embedded screen recorder;
# Upload the video to a Confluence page.
# Publish de the page and click on the video thumbnail.

h3. Expected Results
* The video will reproduce with sound as expected.

h3. Actual Results
* The video has no sound.

h3.Workaround
* No workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Videos captured in iOS devices screen recorder do not reproduce sound when added to pages.

fields.description:
h3. The Suggestion
At the moment we are not able to resize columns when utilizing the Columns macro in Confluence Cloud. It would be nice to allow users to resize those, to increase the number of possible layouts when creating content. 

h3. Steps to Replicate
# Create a page
# Insert a column macro
# Try to resize it

h3 Expected Results
You should be able to resize it without any issues

h3. Actual Results
You are not able to. 

h3 Notes
This also happens for migrated content from the previous to the new editor. So the migration process should also be taken into consideration when implementing the fix.
fields.summary: Allow users to resize columns from the column macro

fields.description:
h3. The Issue
On the previous editor, it was possible to edit the image's sizes when inserting a column macro. On the new editor though, you are only allowed to delete the image. 

h3. Steps to replicate
# Create a new page
# Insert a column macro
# Insert an image
# Try to resize it

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to drag & resize images, just like you do with them on the page's body

h3. Actual Results
You're not.
fields.summary: Column macro does not allow users to resize images on new editor

fields.description:
Presently the *attachment* deletion permission is granted at space level but need the granular approach for *page attachment* level.

This would be helpful in scenarios where admin wants a few users to have the privilege to delete page attachment, at the Page Restrictions level.
fields.summary: Delete attachment permission for a page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When existing pages contained MS Office files and PDFs uploaded and displayed as links in the page. Clicking these links would previously open a preview of the file content in the browser. Once the page is "converted" not to the new mode, clicking these links will only download the Office files and PDFs rather than preview them.

 

Adding a new MS Office file as an attachment to a fabric editor page will only display a grey box. No choice to display as a thumbnail or as a link. Clicking the attached Office file will display the file in preview mode, but there is no longer an option to edit the file through Atlassian Companion browser app.


h3. Environment

Fabric Editor


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page with Old editor. Upload a PDF and word files and display as a link

# Migrate the page to Fabric Editor

# Preview the file added in step 1 

# Add a new word file to the page

# Click the file to preview and edit the Word file using the Atlassian Companion App.

h3. Expected Results

* The MS Office files and PDFs uploaded and displayed as links in the old editor should be converted properly to the new editor. With the new editor, there should be an option to edit the MS Office Files using the Atlassian Companion App.

h3. Actual Results

* No Preview option on MS Office files and PDFs that were added using the old editor

* No option to edit the MS Office files added using the new editor

h3.Workaround

- No workaround.
fields.summary: Office File issue with New Confluence Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Excerpt Include Macro shows error "Unsupported Content" in published mode. In edit mode, it works fine and shows the content of macro as expected.

h3. Environment

* Confluence Cloud
* Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a page in edit mode(new editor) and use excerpt include macro using the page which already has excerpt macro on it.
# The content of the excerpt macro will show up in the excerpt include macro in edit mode.

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to see the content of the excerpt macro on the excerpt include macro in view mode/published mode.

h3. Actual Results
You will see an error: *Unsupported Content* in view mode/published mode.
(i) Note: Attached screenshot of the error in Published mode.


h3. Workaround
NA
fields.summary: Excerpt Include Macro shows error "Unsupported Content" in published mode

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 13 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

As we're working through this feature and others, we wanted to address a lot of your concerns as to the future of the new editor and legacy editor.

Please read our recent community post here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476

Thanks,
Avinoam

{panel}

h3. Summary
Pages using section (right Sidebar) are converted to two column content after migrating to Fabric Editor. Editing a page with two columns, where there is a table in one of the columns will at random upon publish cause the table to have a distorted layout; one extreme is one table column being very narrow creating a table that is veeeery long. This will happen even if the user has not touched the table in the last edit.

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page using the Old Editor. 
# Add a section (right Sidebar)
# Add table in one section
# Migrate the Content to Fabric Editor
# Edit the page

h3. Expected Results
* It should provide a right sidebar column after migration

h3. Actual Results
* Pages with section (rights sidebar) are converted to two column content after migration

h3. Notes
* Would there be an option to two column sidebar soon?

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Section in Fabric Editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing a Word file with images to Confluence with new editor, the images are showing properly. However, after migrating the content to Fabric editor, the images are all shows in the editor as placeholders with the text "inline-media-image". Page without images are displayed after publish.

h3. Environment
Fabric Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Use the new editor model to create a new page with the same content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The encoding for @ it is not working as expected when navigating in Spaces.

*Example:* If we import a personal space in Confluence Cloud, the spacekey will be the email address, and when navigating the encoding it is not working, the address _~rscripcaru@atlassian.com_ is encoded to _~rscripcaru%40atlassian.com_ and the *Blog*/*Overview* page will fail to load with the error in the *Developer tools:*

"No space with key: ~rscripcaru%40atlassian.com"
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Space with the spacekey email address rscripcaru@atlassian.com
 # Notice that if we check *Space Settings*, the page is properly loaded
 # Whereas if we check *Overview*/*Blog* pages, there is an error:
 *Something went wrong* 
Refresh the page and try again. If this keeps happening, let us know using the link below.

h3. Expected Results

The page should load as expected
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-08 at 13.21.18.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The page is returning an error, due to encoding.
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-08 at 13.21.18.png|thumbnail!

The below exception is thrown in the Developer tools:
{noformat}
PageTreeController.js:494 PageTree error 
{networkError: null, graphQLErrors: Array(1)}
graphQLErrors: Array(1)
0: {message: "No space with key: ~rscripcaru%40atlassian.com", path: Array(2), extensions: {…}}
length: 1
__proto__: Array(0)
networkError: null
__proto__: Object
{noformat}
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

As the spacekey cannot be changed from the UI, please open a support case with [us|https://support.atlassian.com/] and we can change the spacekey for you until a permanent fix for this bug will be deployed.
fields.summary: Error: Page tree failed to load due to encoding not working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The [Save for Later|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/save-for-later-136552.html] feature is not available on the overview (home page) of spaces, thus, users cannot add an overview page to Save for Later
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide ability to save overview page for later.
h3. Why this is important

There can still be a lot of important information on an Overview page that users might want to come back to.
h3. Workaround
h4. Workaround #1 (does not require any special permissions)
 # Navigate to the Space Directory {{[https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/spacedirectory/view.action|https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spacedirectory/view.action]}}
 # Favorite the space whose overview page you want to save for later.

Note, this only adds the space as a favorite so you can quickly come back to it in the Space Directory.
h4. Workaround #2 (requires Space Admin rights)
 # Navigate to the overview page you want to save for later.
 # Hover over the *Edit* icon on the top right (the pencil icon). At the bottom of your browser, make a note of the page ID number.
 # Format the URL to the overview page as such: {{[https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/pages/PAGE_ID_NUMBER/PAGE+TITLE|https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/pages/PAGE_ID_NUMBER/PAGE+TITLE]}} (Save this URL, do not browse to it yet, as it will redirect to the overview page.
 # Navigate to the *Space Settings* of the space (Click on the space name in the sidebar and choose the cog icon.)
 # Click *Edit Space Details* and set a new page as your home page. Please note this is temporary!
 # In a 2nd browser tab, now you may navigate to the URL you built earlier. From this page, you'll be able to Save for Later!
 # Set the home page back.
 # Check your *Save for Later* page, but the page should still be there.
fields.summary: Ability to save space overview home pages in Save for Later

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users create page comments or update pages in the editor we give them the option to watch the page (tick mark) which they can opt out of. However, when they create an inline comment we automatically autowatch the page without giving them the option to opt out. We should stop auto watching the page when inline comments are created.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create and publish a page
 # Create an inline comment on the page
 # Have someone do an action on the page (update, like, comment) on the page
 # You'll receive notifications

h3. Expected Results

You don't watch the page and don't receive notifications when you create an inline comment
h3. Actual Results

You automatically watch the page and receive notifications when you create an inline comment, with no option to opt out of watching the page when commenting.
h3. Workaround

Manually unwatching the page
fields.summary: Creating an inline comment on a page causes the user to autowatch the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when you configure the application to [allow anonymous access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/setting-up-public-access-934718729.html], the spaces will have the same options for normal users, like adding/removing pages, attach files, restrict pages. Similar to [this bug|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-58287] in which the anonymous users are prompted to login when they try to create a new page, this report goes for the *Restrictions* and *Add attachment* permissions of the space.

If such permissions are granted, the anonymous user *will not* see the Restrictions options for the page (the padlock, or, under the page tools) and also, if trying to attach a file to a page, a message stating that there was an "Error connecting to server".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a publicly available space by allowing anonymous access to confluence and providing all permissions to anonymous users under space permissions.
# Make sure to grant the anonymous user with the *add* permission for attachments and to *add* restrictions as well
# As an anonymous user, search for the restrictions option or try to upload a new attachment to the page.

h3. Expected Results
The restrictions options should be displayed and the user should be able to upload a new attachment.

h3. Actual Results
The restrictions dialog will not be displayed and the user should be able to attach a new file.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Anonymous users not able to add attachments or restrict pages

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to add many users at once, to a group, the UI displays a list of 100 users or so. After adding some users, to the group,  this list does not update to include more users, and it remains limited to the original 100 or so users
h3. Environment
Instance with a large user base, more than 100 users. Site admins may need to add a great number of users to a group at once. 
When adding users on a group page, a list of users is displayed, but this list is limited to about 100 users, and once the admin has added a number of users, e.g. 5, the list will still display 95 users, instead of updating itself and showing 100 users (5 of them being freshly added to the list).
This can be frustrating if the customer has a lot of users on his/her instance, as he/she would have to type the name of desired users, instead of choosing from a list.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access *Groups* on user management
# Create a new group/select an existing group > *Add members*
 # Start adding users to the group by selecting them from a user list, or typing their name

h3. Expected Results
* User list would be updated to include new users, to replace those already selected. 
* New users could be selected once the user list is updated, instead of typing their name.

h3. Expected Results
* User list is not updated, and remain with the original users.
* Unable to select new users from the list, instead admin would have to start typing names (if user is not on this list)

h3. Workaround
* The workaround would be typing user names directly.
fields.summary: When adding users to a group, the UI displays a list of about 100 users, but this list does not update once some users were added into the group

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The {{attachment_viewed}} webhook intermittently fires depending on the attachment being viewed.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Connect Inspector (https://connect-inspector.prod.public.atl-paas.net/page/start)
# Create a new Confluence page and attach a video
# Ensure the video is embedded in the page (either as a link or a thumbnail), and save
# When viewing the page, click the video (which opens the preview, allowing you to watch the video)
# Observe that no attachment_viewed webhook is fired

h3. Expected Results
When an attachment is viewed, the webhook is fired

h3. Actual Results
The webhook is not fired for video attachments. For image and PDF, it is intermittently being sent (see notes for more info). 

h3. Notes 
* The {{attachment_viewed}} webhook only fires when the attachment is downloaded by clicking the download button.
* If the attachment is an image, Shift + Reload the page fires {{attachment_viewed}}
* If the attachment is a video, it does not fire
* If the attachment is a PDF file, {{attachment_viewed}} is sent when the attachment is clicked right after creation, after this the pattern is to when it will be sent next is not yet clear

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: The attachment_viewed webhook doesn't consistently fire when an attachment is viewed

h3. Summary
In Confluence, when using the [Code Block macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/code-block-macro-724765175.html] including a "less than" character in front of an URL between double quotes, the same will be converted into &lt characters:

!code1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Created/edit a new page in Confluence
# Insert the *Code Block* macro and put text including an URL (https or http) between quotes, into a "less than" and "major than" characters (for example, http://<thisisatest>)
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results
The URL should be properly displayed with the configured parameters by the users:

!codea.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The parameters are converted and will end up interrupting on the URL's display.

h3. Notes
* This will not happen with other characters not tied to an URL, like the example below:
!nocode.png|thumbnail!
* This will not happen if those are not between quotes

h3.Workaround
Use the *HTML and XML* Syntax highlighting in order to have it properly displaying.
fields.summary: Characters are converted when using URL characters for Code Block

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not able to share a confluence page to mail list: server-qe@atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On Windows, if the user inserts/create text with the formatting of "Heading" 1 or 2, there is a scroll bar appearing on a page that contains sections.

h3. How to replicate
# Create a page.
# Insert two sections - one above, one below.
# Add Heading 1 or 2 texts to the sections, no paragraph text.
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected results
The text should properly be displayed on the page, without any appears on the page as normal.

h3. Actual results
The text appears on the page and each section has its own scrollbar.

 !Confluence Header Bug.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Tested with the Legacy Editor only
* This does not happen with MAC OS.

h3. Workaround
* Change the affected texts in Heading 1 or 2 to a different heading (or Paragraph) 
* Zoom out the page to 60% in the browser
fields.summary: A scroll bar appears on the page containing sections and heading text in Windows

fields.description:
Customer Scenario

{quote}
This is a scenario where let's say 10 User stories were created in JIRA from a confluence page using JIRA issue creator.  

Further to this, after a week in I add 5 more user stories in Confluence document, I want to create 5 more Jira issue user stories from the page and there is no easy way because: 

* EITHER I can create only one issue at a time, so have to repeat issue creator 5 times and on top of that there are few issues with single issue creation as explained above. 
* OR I have to create multiple issues, however in this case it will create 15 issues (10 old ones already created + 5 New). So this would cause duplication of issues for first 10 tickets already created in past. {quote}

At the moment, Jira issue creator wasn't smart enough to exclude existing ticket that has already created and it could duplicate Jira issue on this case scenario.

Possible Solution on this.

* Upon creating Jira issues, Jira will return a query or link that populate all the existing link from Jira issue creator and allow user to untick/unselect the ticket that has created previously to avoid duplication.
* Create an option to create ticket without the pre-existing ticket with the same information and columns
fields.summary: Ability to create consecutive stories from Jira issue creator.

fields.description:
Currently, there wasn't any way to change the default numbers of Jira links on the page as it always display the link to *Show more X more in System Jira* which could result in an issue for us when the numbers of Jira issue links is less than 5 whereby this link doesn't create on the Jira Issues link from Confluence. 

The link is extremely useful for user to view all the links directly on Jira. But it doesn't show if the Jira issues links is less than 5.
fields.summary: Ability to include the numbers of issues link then the Jira links is less than 5

fields.description:
The Page Tree Search Macro's results will not allow you to go to the second page of results on certain queries (hypothesis is that it's caused by attachments).

 # Add a Page Tree search Macro
 # Search for a term in the same space which should provide more than 10 results and preferably have results in attachments too.

h3. Expected Results
You can navigate between results without an issue 
h3. Actual Results

"Oops, something went wrong with your search.

We could not successfully complete the search. Missing closing quote on string ("ancestorIds:1409043 AND CAN C) near field siteSearch

h3. Notes
During the investigation it was observed that  on first attempt the url for the 2nd query page has a format like [REDACTED]dosearchsite.action?queryString=ancestorIds%3A1409043+AND+CAN+C%23+JAVA&where=BO&cql=siteSearch+~+"ancestorIds%3A1409043+AND+CAN+C

But once you refresh and try again, it will give the correct link:
[REDACTED]dosearchsite.action?cql=siteSearch+~+"ancestorIds%3A1409043+AND+CAN+C%23+JAVA"&queryString=ancestorIds%3A1409043+AND+CAN+C%23+JAVA&startIndex=10

h3. Workaround

Rerunning the search fixes it, but this is not immediately apparent to users.
fields.summary: Can't browse to the 2nd page of page tree search results under certain circumstances

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After saving the *Created vs Resolved* or the *Time to First Response* gadgets settings, it's not possible to edit it.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud and Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the *Created vs Resolved* or the *Time to First Response* gadget to a page;
# Configure it with a project and hit *Save* on the gadget settings, not the macro;
# Try to edit it again;

h3. Expected Results
It should allow for saving;

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't show the *Save* button for the gadget's configurations.

h3. Workaround
No know workaround besides creating a new gadget.
A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When editing a Jira Gadget macro, the internal Save button is not shown

fields.description:
h3. Editor fails to load

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a published page in Confluence Cloud
# Click the *Edit* (pencil) Icon

h3. Expected Results
Editor loads as expected.

h3. Actual Results
Editor fails to load with the following message displayed in the upper-right hand corner of the window:

{quote}
Something went wrong after loading the editor. Copy your unsaved changes and refresh the page to keep editing
{quote}

The below error is seen in browser console:
{code}
Synchrony: Error: entity destroyed
{code}

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, for now, you can refresh the page each time this happens and it should fix the issue.
fields.summary: Editor fails to load - "Something went wrong after loading the editor." message displayed

fields.description:
Currently, when you create multiple issues form a table in a Confluence Page, you can map cells to fields in the created Jira issues. 

If you create a single issue, this option is not there. It would be nice for the Jira Issue Macro to  pick up on the context, and allow the selection of a table cell, instead of having to copy paste the text manually.
fields.summary: Improve Single Issue Create from Confluence to pick up content in a table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the *Labels gadget in Confluence* and configuring the same to retrieve specific labels from specific Jira projects, the same will only display the content as raw HTML, instead of the Jira content itself.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Confluence page using the legacy editor (on the new editor, if you try to use this gadget/macro, the same will redirect the user to the *Activity Stream* macro/gadget edit mode, which is not expected as well)
 # Add the *Labels Gadget* macro and apply any configuration that will work, or, not identify any labels.
 # Publish the page, or, simply check the result while editing the gadget/macro.

h3. Expected Results

The macro/gadget content should be displayed properly.
h3. Actual Results

Only raw HTML is displayed instead:

!html.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * This can't be tested on the new editor as the same does not work there. Instead, it redirects the user to the *Activity Stream* macro/gadget.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Labels gadget only shows content as raw HTML

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to share the URL of an unpublished blog post or a page using the new editor (like Meeting Notes) (only a draft, once it has not been published yet), any other user that tries to access the URL/that has been invited will face a "Page not found" message:

!notfound.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment

* Confluence [new editor only|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to tap the *create/+* button in order to create a new page or blog. If selecting a page, make sure that the same is using the new editor (Meeting notes, for example)
# Copy the draft URL and do not publish the same, or, use the *invite to edit* feature (plus icon near your profile thumbnail while editing a page)
# Provide the URL to a user with access to the space
# Ask the same to access it

h3. Expected Results
The draft should load with the current editings/content of the user.

h3. Actual Results
A "Page not found" message is displayed.

h3. Notes

* After the same has been published, sharing the *edit* URL for the page will work
* The unpublished page/draft URL will look something like the following:

https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/spacekey/blog/edit-v2/293044233?draftShareId=5877dc2d-3b33-4b20-83f4-70ae03def21d

(Optional - If Necessary)

h3. Workaround

Publish the draft first, and then, share the *edit* URL.
fields.summary: Sharing unpublished Blog/page with the new editor leads to a "Page not found" message

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When impersonating a user, on the quick search Confluence is respecting the permissions of the user that is impersonating (*Site-admin*) and not the permissions of the user that is being impersonated.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user *User B* without space permission on *Space A*
# Create a page name "testing page" in that space
# Have two users, *User A* as a member of the *Administrators* group and as a *site-admin* and *User B* as a regular user
# On a quick search of user B, the restricted page doesn't show up on the list.
# When *User A* impersonate *User B* the page show up on the quick search.

h3. Expected Results
The quick search should respect the permissions of the user that is being impersonated *User B* and not display the restricted page

h3. Actual Results
When impersonating the *User B* the quick search is not respecting the permissions of the impersonating user, instead, it is respecting the permissions of the *User A* (site-admin)
 

This leads the site-admin to believe that the impersonated user can search for the page but in fact, they can't.

h3.Workaround
No workaround so far
fields.summary: When impersonating a user the quick search is not respecting the impersonated user permissions

Error rendering macro 'show-if' : null

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to view the macro

No.

    at v (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:14)

{code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are beign granted additional undesired permissions on a space if permissions were granted to anonymous users under "Anonymous" section of Space Settings.

Scenario: A specific group was created and should only be able to View a space and its pages, without beign able to edit those pages.  This group was granted only "View" permission on space settings. Anonymous users had many permissions on this space, including "*Page-add*" permission. Even though users of the specific group were not granted "*Page-add*" permission on this space they were able to add and edit pages.


h3. Environment
* Users were added into a single group (e.g. 'view-only') that had only "*View*" permission on a Space.
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-29 at 17.01.52.png|thumbnail! 
* Anonymous access was to Confluence disabled on Global Permissions
* Space permissions were set to only allow this specific group ('view-only') to only view this space (no other permissions were added to this group besides "View")
* On Space settings Anonymous users were granted "*View*" and "*Page - add*" permissions.
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-29 at 17.02.12.png|thumbnail! 
* Users of the group 'view-only' were able to add and edit pages without any restrictions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that Anonymous access is disabled on Global Permissions
# Add a group to space and grant it only "*View*" permission
# Under 'Anonymous' section, on Space permissions, grant anonymous users "*View*" and "*Page - add*"



h3. Expected Results
* Users of the 'view-only' would not be able to add or edit any pages under this space, as they didn't have "*Page - add*" permission on this space.

h3. Actual Results
* Users of the group 'view-only' were able to add and edit pages without any restrictions. 


h3. Workaround
 Remove all permissions granted to anonymous users under this space and from that point on users of the 'view-only' group won't be granted additional unwanted permissions.
fields.summary: Users were granted additional permissions on a space if anonymous users had permissions granted to them under Space Settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While in Jira, it recognizes the following filter: 

{code}statusCategory not in("In Progress"){code}

In Confluence (when using Jira Issue filter macro), it doesn't accept it. Only with the "space":

{code}statusCategory not in ("In Progress"){code}

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page 
# Add Jira issue filter macro to the page 
# Enter the following filter or similar (not containing spaces): {code}statusCategory not in("In Progress"){code}

h3. Expected Results
Just like Jira, Confluence should be able to recognise the same filter without errors. 

h3. Actual Results
Confluence doesn't bring any results. 

h3. Workaround
Add a space between the words in the filter.
fields.summary: Jira Issue macro in Confluence doesn't accept spaces within the filter

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
site-admin cannot modify or control permissions for personal spaces in the instance. He needs to ask the owner of the space to control permissions.

h3. Suggested Solution
site-admin should be able to control/manage permissions for personal spaces.

h3. Why this is important
* If the owner of the personal space leaves the organization then how the site-admin will recover the space.
* site-admin doesn't want the space to be kept personal, as the owner might save content that is against the organization laws
 
h3. Workaround 
NA
fields.summary: Allow site-admins the ability to control permissions on personal spaces of the instance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Weh using the macro to create JIRA issues from a Confluence table which has both column and row headers, the summary and description fields are incorrectly mapped.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table on a Confluence page with both column and row headers
 # Use the create multiple issues from table macro
 # Try and map the columns to summary and description as desired

h3. Expected Results

Columns map correctly
h3. Actual Results

The summary is mapped to the next column along as though the column header is throwing the mapping off by one column:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Remove the column header from the Confluence table.

Work-around: remove table numbers so that the first column is the subject and not a row number.
fields.summary: Creating multiple issue from a table with a column and row headers maps summary and description fields incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Import of Confluence Cloud site backup fails during import.

This bug is for the failure being caused by violation of the unique constraint *cp_unique_user*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform site backup of Confluence Cloud site that has restricted pages. 
 # Try and import the backup to either a new or the same cloud site. 

h3. Expected Results
The import completes successfully.
 
h3. Actual Results
The import will fail part way through:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the Splunk logs:
{noformat}
message: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "cp_unique_user"
  Detail: Key (cps_id, cp_type, username)=(815818, View, <hash>) already exists.
{noformat}

This would suggest either duplicate records in the database of the site where the backup was taken or in the resulting entities.xml, however, investigation of both these should prove this not to be the case.

h3. Notes
* _This will need to be confirmed by Atlassian Support in our internal logs_

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Importing a cloud site backup fails due to unique constraint violation cp_unique_user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*.
+*This is a REGRESSION BUG that is carried over after migration from a server environment that does not have the database workaround fix applied.*+
{panel}
{panel:title=Update from Atlassian|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
This issue has been resolved in Confluence 5.9.8.

The fix we implemented is in the front end, and stops duplicate user records from displaying anywhere in Confluence - in the People Directory, Shares, or Mentions. The underlying duplicates may still exist in the database, and new duplicates may be created, however these are harmless and can be safely ignored. As of Confluence 5.9.8, you should no longer see duplicate users in People Directory, shares, mentions in Confluence. For duplicated users displayed in the search result, refer to CONFSERVER-56554
{panel}
h3. Symptoms
 * Users appear twice in the People Directory, in shares, and mentions
 * Users have two USERINFO records with no 'prevver' value (ie two current records), eg:
{code:java}
select * from content where contenttype like 'USERINFO' and prevver is null;
{code}
(i) USERINFO records that do *not* have an entry in prevver are the currently active records. This is a little counter-intuitive given the name of the field, however older records that are no longer active contain the id of the superseding record in prevver. If prevver is null, the record is considered active.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This may not be the only way to have this happen, but doing the following sequence will cause this to happen:
#  Click on the '+' icon to create a new page.
# Select the 'Retrospective Template'.
# In the 'Participants' field, while adding some users, search returns duplicated records.
# Upon checking the database, duplicate USERINFO records in the 'content' table will be available:
{code:sql}
SELECT c.username
      FROM CONTENT c
      WHERE
        contenttype LIKE 'USERINFO'
        AND prevver is null
          GROUP BY c.username
          HAVING count(c.username)>1;
{code}


h3. Known Triggers

This has been confirmed to occur on upgrade to 5.1.3, and possibly earlier or later versions. Carried over to cloud when migrated from server

h3. Diagnosis - is this affecting you?

First, try a content reindex. If this doesn't help, run this query (on any version). If it returns any results, this bug is the cause of your duplicates.
{code:sql}
SELECT c.username
      FROM CONTENT c
      WHERE
        contenttype LIKE 'USERINFO'
        AND prevver is null
          GROUP BY c.username
          HAVING count(c.username)>1;
{code}
If this query returns nothing, have a look at CONF-36018 as well.
h3. Work Around
 # Make a site backup, database backup.
 # Run this SQL command to find the usernames of affected users - ensure these match what you are seeing in the People Directory before deleting
{code:sql}
// FOR CONFLUENCE 5.3 AND ABOVE
SELECT m.username FROM content c
 JOIN user_mapping m ON c.username = m.user_key
  WHERE c.username IN
    (SELECT c.username
      FROM CONTENT c
      WHERE
        contenttype LIKE 'USERINFO'
        AND prevver is null
          GROUP BY c.username
          HAVING count(c.username)>1)
    GROUP BY m.username;

// FOR CONFLUENCE 5.2 AND BELOW
SELECT c.username FROM CONTENT c
  WHERE c.username IN
    (SELECT c.username
      FROM CONTENT c
      WHERE
        contenttype LIKE 'USERINFO'
        AND prevver is null
          GROUP BY c.username
          HAVING count(c.username)>1)
    GROUP BY c.username;
{code}
# Run this command to delete the duplicate entries (all versions). The row with the higher {{contentid}} will be deleted.
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM CONTENT
WHERE prevver IN
    (SELECT DISTINCT c1.contentid AS "pageid"
     FROM CONTENT c1
     JOIN CONTENT c2 ON c1.username = c2.username
     WHERE c1.contenttype = 'USERINFO'
     AND c2.contenttype = 'USERINFO'
     AND c1.prevver is null 
     AND c2.prevver is null 
     AND c1.contentid > c2.contentid);

DELETE FROM CONTENT
WHERE contentid IN
    (SELECT DISTINCT c1.contentid AS "pageid"
     FROM CONTENT c1
     JOIN CONTENT c2 ON c1.username = c2.username
     WHERE c1.contenttype = 'USERINFO'
     AND c2.contenttype = 'USERINFO'
     AND c1.prevver is null 
     AND c2.prevver is null 
     AND c1.contentid > c2.contentid);{code}
# Run a Confluence site content re-index.
fields.summary: Users are duplicated when adding 'Participants' in the new Retrospective page template, and multiple USERINFO records in the "content" table of the database for these users are found

fields.description: Currently, there is only the ability to add the burndown report as a macro to a Confluence page. fields.description:
h4.Summary

In Confluence, when a user is removed from the application, the same will be still displayed on the restrictions and permissions that belonged to the same, but, instead of the original name/username, it will display a "Former/Unknown User" entry. This can benefit users in which will have the deleted user coming back, and also, add-on users that were removed and could be used further.

However, in situations in which a deleted user is no longer needed, or, an add-on is removed from the Cloud application, these entries can be time-consuming to be removed as the administrator would need to access each of the pages/spaces that the add-on user/former user had access in order to "clean" the current permissions. 

h4.Suggestion

To not change the whole "former user" structure and allow the same entry to be used if the user/add-on comes back, the suggestion would be to have some option tied to being able to remove all the "Former Users" entry from Confluence's administration.
fields.summary: Option to remove all "Former Users" when a user is deleted

fields.description: The Confluence Page History does not show me who changed a page; it shows icons in the Changed By field; I have to hover over each icon to find out who it is.  Please change it to show the person's name, or at least their username.
fields.summary: Show usernames in Confluence Page History Changed By field; not icons

fields.description:
When a user has been affected by some specific scenario in which the links used in the instance, the same must manually search for the specific link(s) in order to either fix or remove the same.

Similar to the *Undefined Pages* feature of Confluence, this is a suggestion to have an option within the space administration displaying a list of broken links in the specific space (including external ones). This would be consisted of:

* A new "Broken Links" option on the *Settings* of the space.
* Only space administrators would have access to it.
* The same would have a method to provide a notification for the space administrators when a new broken link has been identified in a recently published page.
* The notification would be optional, similar to the *watches* option
fields.summary: List of broken links within a space in Confluence
